CatDescriptText: Lillie Mitchell, housewife, 1734 Cliff Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 28, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think race relations are improved, are worse, or about the same today as compared to pre-World War II years?" answer reads: "Just a little improved, but not very much. Negroes now have more privileges than they had before.  Conditions should be improved that much more."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Lillie Mitchell wearing dark tweed coat with wide collar, and button earrings, posed in front of building
